result.execSummary:
The defendant Irvin L McGeshick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 1 day only if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must submit a DNA sample.

The defendant must undergo an anger management course and follow thru with all recommendations.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions as count #1 except no additional community service.
Concurrent with: Count #1

records.addlTxt: Defendant Irvin L McGeshick in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:06 PM. State - resolved - have complied with victim notification requirements with no response, enter G pleas to both counts as alleged, place on probation for 1 year on each count, court costs only on each count, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, 50 hours of community service as approved by P&P, any and all other conditions as deemed appropriate by P&P. Burns and McGeshick agree. McGeshick pleads G to counts #1 and #2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - credit for one day if revoked. McGeshick withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: costs on each count (including domestic abuse enhancer and DNA surcharge) - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, 50 hours community service (total), right to appeal, submit DNA sample and expungement collaquey given, credit for 1 day if revoked, adjourned.
voluntary waiver request to waive the court ordered no contact provision

Defendant Irvin L McGeshick in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:02 AM. Burns has complaint, waives reading, enters NG pleas to all counts, requests FPT, makes statememnt that she believes the no-contact provision with the victim has been lifted. Court reviews file and does not see it in the file, Court accepts pleas, continues bond as is at this point, set for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Irvin L McGeshick in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:23 AM. McGeshick handed complaint in Court. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. McGeshick understands charges and penalties, does not want an attorney and plans on pleading NC today. Court instructs on what State could ask for today. McGeshick now wants an attorney. Court instructs to contact SPD and given court appointed paperwork in Court. Court continues bond and sets for AIA on 9/9/15 at 10:30 AM.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with victim (Paula- girlfriend)
